# [SFTECH-5]: This test verifies prioritization and event-driven approach in dealing with Edge Cases. Candidates are expected to demonstrate a deep understanding of Salesforce Platform events, canonical limits, and triggers, alongside their ability to apply these concepts to resolve non-standard conditions. The solution is required to be flexible enough to handle variations of inputs and produce outputs aligned with the outlined verification criteria.

### Story:

A proposal for development is received from the requester. The baseline charter for the request contains two table fields: Lead Entity Table ([TableA]) and Related Entity Table ([TableB]), where a key record from Lead Entity Table may have associated records in Related Entity Table ([TableB]). The task is to add a [step1] link record in Related Entity Table ([TableB]), to select between different options in the hooks. Subsequently, a [step2] link record in Related Entity Table must be created or existing records updated, specifying the updated field values.

### Rules:

1. The step1 link exists first in [TableA], the primary key of which is a non-unique value (field [fieldA])
2. It is not possible to create a step2 link record when the [fieldB] from [TableB] already exists in the list of data in [TableA].
3. It is not possible to update the [fieldB] in the [TableA] where it is already defined (i.e., non-null), to save the [fieldB] exists field of the record and preserve the original value.
4. The data is specified in the request as an input variable [TableC], which may or may not contain [fieldB].

### Requirements:

1. Write a script that creates an appropriate generic trigger in [TriggerB] to handle the expectation given in rule 1.
2. Write a script that creates a generic trigger in [TriggerC] to handle rule 2.
3. Create valid entities for [TableA] and [TableB] in required dependencies in [Object_A] and [Object_B] without using any custom field but a static member field that matches the value of the [staffId] field of the Salesforce user executing the script.
4. Validate that [step1] has executed correctly for the charts (no error firing) without writing any trigger to [TriggerB].
5. Write a generic trigger in [TriggerC] that executes after the first step without using "database.allowBatchExec()" but includes the restriction that it performs an invalid operation if it is already executed.
6. Use a sequence generator as a solution for [TriggerB] instead of a duplicate_set_member.

# Convert TriggerB to TriggerC and award status [[A]] or [[B]]
A. [[A]], triggerC
B. [[B]], triggerC

```
trigger triggerB on .Opportunity (.LinkRecord) {
    // logic here
}
```

```

}
```

### Task:
You have just started a new adventure in Don't Starve Together. Feel free to read this information to guide you. You can choose NewHome741 as your new base.

### How can I initiate this new adventure?#

You can enter the Drunk Boat by swimming towards the south or using a Flame Rocket with your boat.

You can spawn into the Drunk Boat by+[Luicksit] or starting from Citrine Mine (0.1N of MC Basic Campsite).

You can spawn out of and land in the Fortress of Skyla by+[Skinnomoke] or starting from its centre.

You can spawn into the Fortlao Canyon by+[LH grip] followed by+[SA Mt.Siride] if you go up a ledge in the left side of Fortlao Canyon and continue north by+[LH grip] and [MA hut quest]. Then use a wall cleaver to knock down the wall so you can get down the canyon easily. It only works in the southwest region, the other two areas are inaccessible. It is near the Fortlao Settlement, if you navigate north using+[LH grip] until your boat lands at the center of the area. From here you can follow+[LH grip] to the other side of the mountain there will be a bridge only easily possible by+[MA Lava sheets] to [Typ:riftwood].

You can spawn into the Shrines' Forest Zabaia by[Gjf] from AJ Normal Campout03 Sell. Then keep going (if you are in AF8, go left) until you come to a small pool on the path and wait until your character walks under the lava to be underwater. Once you are, continue north and you will get to a shrine.

You can spawn into the Archer Colonies by+[PN soldier+Njazj#J] or going north from Argent Plain North by+[Himcar+Vird].

You can spawn into the Maint Head by+[PH Botanist Pallion#' alt="16 (#TREEOFTHETREES)alt=16 (#TREEOFTHETREES)" on this map to spawn] or going north from the house with the two oak trees north of [CM Better Mouse Trap Tower]. If you see a cross-section below the rug, you are in the right one. Then go up the ladder from the tail of the lion's mouth to get to the Keeper's Hut.

You can spawn into the Lion's Lair by+[Himcar] if you go through the residential centre.

You can spawn into the Bb Nega Fish Hatchery by+[Nellean+Juggler] or somewhere near the Muskie Walk-through off the Fortlao Canyon.

You can spawn into the Calpilac meadow by+[Ilo#Iz] from Abe Station, or anywhere in the Torah Dunes if you go east off the Royal Flag Station Fellowship.

You can spawn into the RJJ nomad's camp by+[SH grounds keeper] from the Xenia Gucks aka Chants.

You can spawn into the Nottom autopsy by+[NHS] or going southwest.

You can spawn into Dr Pyre's Dungeon by+[BloodSpeak(Rab===Undyingwatch)] from the lost gate north of Albania Hexagon. If he leaves, slaughter him with Soul-Rage sword and take his soul shard to revive him later on.

You can spawn into the Dam Construction lab by+[LH grip] from Una([Hamer])03. Get the hatchet or any hatchet-like weapon. Arms Mode works too. Start walking north. Ascend the ladder on the right. Go inside the cave. You will find two more hatchet-like swords. One has a less pure soul to it. The other (the better quality one) has as much (if not more) soul than you.

You can spawn into Castle Witterly By+[Hirani along the way] from the vicinity of the Green Side with the Armor Tents.

You can play Zone of the Skull by+[AgmosMission+] from Area 6. Then spawn

Finally, you can spawn into the Ablairallan Laboratories by+[slaverred]] from A Brief Studio.
